recipes.name: Authentic Ginger Tea (Adrak Ki Chai)
ingredients: 3 teaspoons loose tea leaves (preferably Assam, Darjeeling, Nilgiri, or Ceylon)
directions: Step 1: In a deep pan, combine the water and whole milk. Place the pan over high heat and bring the mixture to a boil.
Step 2: Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and add the grated ginger. Allow the mixture to simmer for a few moments to infuse the ginger flavor.
Step 3: Increase the heat again until the mixture reaches a boil, then quickly add the loose tea leaves.
Step 4: Once the tea leaves are added and the mixture has returned to a boil, promptly turn off the heat.
Step 5: Cover the pan and let the tea brew for 2 minutes to achieve the desired strength.
Step 6: Strain the tea into cups using a fine mesh strainer to remove the ginger and tea leaves.
Step 7: Add sugar or a sugar substitute to taste, stirring well to dissolve.
Step 8: Serve the ginger tea hot and enjoy a test sip to ensure it is at a safe drinking temperature.

Arrange the cup on a rustic wooden table with a few loose tea leaves scattered nearby and a small dish of sugar. Incorporate a sprig of fresh ginger as a garnish, shooting from a slightly elevated angle to highlight the drink's inviting warmth and inviting steam, with a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, creating an intimate and cozy mood.

recipes.name: Refreshing Orange Iced Tea
ingredients: 1 tablespoon black tea (Tazo or English Breakfast), steeped
2 medium oranges (Navel or nectarines), juiced and sliced for garnish
directions: 1. Steep the Tea: Bring 2 cups of water to a rolling boil. For a stronger flavor, add the loose black tea leaves and boil for 8-10 minutes. Alternatively, you can add 2 tea bags to hot water, turn off the heat, and allow them to steep for 8-10 minutes.

2. Filter and Juice: Use a strainer to remove the tea leaves and set the brewed tea aside to cool for about 5 minutes. While the tea cools, juice 1.5 oranges and, if desired, strain the juice. Cut the remaining half orange into 4 slices for garnish.
3. Combine Ingredients: Once the brewed tea has cooled to room temperature, mix in the freshly squeezed orange juice and honey. Stir well until thoroughly combined.

4. Serve: Place two orange slices in each tall glass, gently pushing them against the sides. Add 5-6 ice cubes to hold the orange slices in place, then pour the orange tea into the glasses and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Perfect Peach Iced Tea
ingredients: 2-3 tablespoons loose leaf black tea or 3-4 tea bags
directions: Step 1: In a small saucepan, combine the organic cane sugar, 1 cup of water, and thinly sliced peaches. Bring the mixture to a boil.
Step 2: Once boiling, reduce the heat and mash the peaches gently with a wooden spoon to release their flavor. Stir continuously until the sugar is completely dissolved.
Step 3: Cover the saucepan and remove it from the heat. Allow the mixture to steep for 25 to 30 minutes to infuse the peach flavor.

Step 4: Meanwhile, brew the black tea in a large pot or tea maker. If using loose leaf tea, pour it into a tea steeper. Adjust the amount to your taste preference, but refrain from steeping for more than 4 to 5 minutes to avoid bitterness.
Step 5: After brewing, remove the tea bags or strain out the loose leaf tea and transfer the brewed tea to a pitcher. Refrigerate the tea until cooled.

Step 6: Once the peach simple syrup has steeped, strain it through a fine mesh strainer into a container to separate the syrup from the peach slices. Reserve the peaches for use in oatmeal or ice cream sundaes if desired.

Step 7: To serve, choose to either pour the peach simple syrup directly into the chilled tea and stir well, or keep them separate and allow guests to adjust the sweetness to their liking. Serve the peach iced tea over ice and garnish with additional fresh peach slices.

recipes.name: Green Tea Layer Cake
directions: Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 8-inch round cake pans.
Step 2: Sift together the all-purpose flour, cake flour, baking soda, salt, and powdered green tea into a bowl. Set aside.
Step 3: In a large mixing bowl, beat together the granulated sugar, vegetable oil, and eggs until the mixture is smooth and well combined.
Step 4: Stir in 1 ½ teaspoons of vanilla extract. Gradually add the flour mixture to the egg mixture, alternating with the plain yogurt, mixing just until incorporated.
Step 5: Divide the batter evenly between the prepared cake pans.
Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Step 7: Allow the cakes to cool in the pans on a wire rack for 30 minutes before turning them out onto the rack to cool completely.
Step 8: For the Green Tea Frosting, sift together the confectioners' sugar and the powdered green tea in a bowl.

Step 9: In a separate medium bowl, combine the sifted sugar and tea mixture with softened butter, cream cheese, ½ teaspoon vanilla extract, and milk. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy.

Step 10: To assemble the cake, place one layer on a serving plate and spread a thin layer of frosting over the top. Top with the second layer and use the remaining frosting to cover the top and sides of the cake.
Step 11: Dust the top with additional powdered green tea, if desired. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.name: The Perfect Pot and Cup of English Tea
ingredients: 3 teaspoons loose Assam tea or Darjeeling tea or English Breakfast tea or Orange Pekoe tea or Lapsang Souchong tea or Earl Grey tea or Ceylon tea
directions: Step 1: Ensure that the kettle or water boiler is de-scaled regularly and that the teapot is spotlessly clean. Warm the teapot by adding hot water, then pour it away.
Step 2: Use the recommended amount of tea, which is 1 teaspoon of loose tea per cup plus an additional teaspoon for the pot.
Step 3: For one person, use a 10-ounce teapot; for two people, a 20-ounce teapot is recommended. Boil water until it is boiling, then add it to the tea immediately.
Step 4: Allow the tea to brew for 3-5 minutes, depending on your desired strength.
Step 5: Stir the tea before serving. Pour a little milk into each cup before straining the tea into the cups, sweetening with granulated sugar or a sugar cube as desired.
Step 6: Optionally, you may omit the milk and instead serve the tea with a slice of lemon.

recipes.name: Grapefruit Tea Refresher
ingredients: 8 individual tea bags (black or green tea)
directions: Step 1: In a clean pan or pot, bring 4 1/2 cups of water to a boil.
Step 2: Once boiling, remove the pot from heat and add the 8 tea bags. Allow to steep for 5 minutes.
Step 3: Carefully remove the tea bags to prevent bitterness from over-steeping.
Step 4: Let the tea cool to room temperature.
Step 5: In a large pitcher, combine the cooled tea, 1 cup of fresh orange juice, and 1/2 cup of fresh grapefruit juice.
Step 6: Stir in 1/3 cup of sugar, adjusting the amount to taste.
Step 7: Serve the tea over ice cubes in a glass.

recipes.name: Chai Tea from Scratch
ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon cardamom pods, minced and slightly crushed
1 inch piece vanilla pod, split lengthwise
2 tablespoons loose black tea leaves or 2 tea bags
2 cups milk or milk substitute (e.g., soy milk, rice milk)
Honey, to taste (or cane sugar, also known as Sucanat)
directions: Step 1: Pour the water into a heavy-bottomed saucepan.
Step 2: Add the cinnamon stick, cardamom pods, black peppercorns, cloves, fennel seeds, split vanilla pod, star anise, saffron threads, anise seeds, nutmeg, and ground ginger to the saucepan.
Step 3: Bring the mixture to a boil, then partially cover the pan and reduce the heat to a simmer. Allow it to simmer for about 20 minutes to let the spices infuse the water.
Step 4: After 20 minutes, add the loose black tea leaves or tea bags to the saucepan. If using loose tea, consider placing it in a tea infuser or muslin cloth.
Step 5: Add the milk or your chosen milk substitute, and gently heat through without bringing it to a boil.
Step 6: Once hot, pour the chai tea through a fine-mesh strainer into tea cups to remove the spices and tea leaves.
Step 7: Sweeten your chai tea with honey or cane sugar to taste.
Step 8: Sit back, sip, close your eyes, relax, and enjoy!

nutrition.calories: 100 per serving (varies based on sweetener and milk used)

Step 4: Gradually incorporate the flour mixture and plain yogurt into the wet ingredients, alternating between the two, until just blended.

Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Allow cakes to cool in the pans for 30 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.
Step 7: While the cakes are cooling, prepare the green tea frosting. Sift together the powdered sugar and 2 teaspoons of powdered green tea in a medium bowl.

Step 8: In another bowl, combine the tea mixture with 2 tablespoons of softened butter, cream cheese, 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla extract, and 1 1/2 teaspoons of milk. Beat with an electric mixer until smooth and well blended.
Step 9: Once the cakes have completely cooled, place one layer on a flat serving plate. Spread a thin layer of frosting on top.
Step 10: Place the second cake layer on top of the frosted layer. Spread the remaining frosting evenly over the top and sides of the cake.
Step 11: If desired, dust the top of the cake with additional green tea powder before serving. Serve chilled or at room temperature.

recipes.name: Iced Earl Grey Tea with Citrus and Mint
ingredients: 10 fluid ounces fresh cold orange juice
directions: Step 1: Brew a strong tea by placing the tea bags in a large teapot and pouring 1 quart of boiling water over them. Let steep for 20 minutes.
Step 2: Remove the tea bags and add honey to the hot tea. Stir until dissolved.
Step 3: Allow the tea to cool to room temperature, then transfer it to the refrigerator until completely chilled.
Step 4: Once the tea is cold, remove the mint sprigs.
Step 5: Fill a large jug with ice cubes, then pour the chilled tea over the ice.
Step 6: Add the freshly squeezed lime juice and the orange juice to the jug. Stir well to combine.
Step 7: Garnish with the remaining mint sprigs and slices of orange and lemon.
Step 8: Serve in glasses filled with more ice.

recipes.name: Basic Tea Jelly
ingredients: 1/4 cup juice (choose a flavor that complements the tea, such as lemon or berry)
directions: Step 1: Bring 1 and 3/4 cups of water to a boil in a saucepan. If omitting the juice, increase the water amount to 2 cups.
Step 2: Remove the boiling water from heat and add 12 tea bags. Steep for 30 minutes.
Step 3: Discard the tea bags and add 3 cups of granulated sugar and the optional 1/4 cup of juice to the brewed tea.
Step 4: Return the mixture to a boil, stirring constantly for 2 minutes. Remove from heat.
Step 5: Stir in 1 package of liquid pectin, return to a full boil, and boil for an additional 1 minute.
Step 6: Skim off any foam that forms on the surface.
Step 7: Pour the hot jelly into sterilized jars, leaving about 1/4 inch of headspace. Process the jars in a boiling water bath for 20 minutes.

recipes.name: Tea and Whiskey Highball
ingredients: 8 teaspoons black tea or 8 tea bags
directions: 1. Using a vegetable peeler, remove the zest from the oranges in wide strips, avoiding as much of the white pith as possible. Set aside half of the zest for steeping and refrigerate the remainder for garnishing.
2. Bring 2 quarts of water to a boil, then remove from heat. Add the tea bags or loose tea along with the reserved orange zest for steeping. Let the mixture steep for 5 minutes.
3. Pour the tea through a fine-mesh strainer into a 3-quart heatproof container, discarding the solids. Refrigerate the tea until cold, at least 3 hours.

4. To prepare the mint syrup, combine granulated sugar, 1 cup water, and the trimmed mint leaves in a small saucepan. Stir to combine and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer, stirring occasionally, until the sugar has completely dissolved and the syrup thickens slightly, about 5 minutes.

5. Remove the syrup from heat and let it cool to room temperature for about 1 hour. Strain the syrup through a fine-mesh strainer set over a medium bowl and discard the solids. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use.
6. To serve, stir the Scotch or bourbon and half of the mint syrup (about 1 cup) into the chilled tea. Taste and adjust sweetness with additional syrup as desired.
7. Fill 8 highball glasses with ice and add several strips of the remaining orange zest to each glass. Pour the tea mixture over the ice, garnish with a sprig of fresh mint, and serve immediately.

directions: 1. In a saucepan, bring the water to a rolling boil.

4. Remove from heat and strain the tea using a tea strainer.

recipes.name: Classic Bubble Tea Recipe
ingredients: 2 teabags of black tea or 2g loose black tea
1 teaspoon dark brown sugar, for boba seasoning
50g dark brown sugar, for sugar syrup
directions: Step 1: Brew the tea by placing the teabags or loose leaves in 100ml boiling water. Allow to steep for 10-15 minutes. Remove the teabags or strain the leaves, then set the brewed tea aside to cool to room temperature.

Step 2: Prepare a clear sugar syrup by combining 50g of caster sugar with 60ml of water in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the mixture comes to a boil, then remove from heat and let it cool.

Step 3: In a separate small saucepan, bring 500ml of water to a rolling boil. Add the quick-cook tapioca balls and stir gently with a rubber spatula to prevent sticking. Maintain a rolling boil for 2 minutes, then turn off the heat but keep the saucepan covered for an additional 2 minutes.

Step 4: Pour the tapioca balls into a sieve and rinse them under cool running water for about 20 seconds to stop the cooking process. Transfer the drained boba to a mixing bowl, add 1 teaspoon of dark brown sugar, and mix thoroughly to coat evenly.

Step 5: Prepare the second sugar syrup by adding 50g of dark brown sugar to 60ml of water in the saucepan over medium heat. Stir until the sugar dissolves and the mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and let it cool. This syrup will thicken as it cools, providing approximately 80ml, enough for 2.5 servings. Store any leftover syrup in a jar in the fridge for up to one month. Mix the cooked boba with the syrup until well-coated; do not refrigerate or they will harden.

Step 6: To assemble the bubble tea, fill a 485ml drinking glass (or two smaller glasses) with the sweetened boba. Pour in the brewed tea and add 1 tablespoon of clear sugar syrup. Mix gently to combine while preserving the marble effect along the sides of the glass.
Step 7: Top the glass with 200ml of milk and serve with a boba straw. Enjoy the bubble tea either hot or cold based on your preference.

recipes.name: Refreshing Summer Peach Iced Tea
ingredients: 2 medium peaches, diced (or 1 cup frozen sliced peaches)
2 regular-size black tea bags (such as Tazo Tea)
directions: Step 1: Bring 2 cups of water to a rolling boil in a saucepan. Once boiling, add the black tea bags and turn off the heat. Allow the tea to steep for about 10 minutes.

Step 2: In another saucepan, combine the diced peaches, honey, and 1 cup of water. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, then reduce to a simmer. Let it simmer for 15 minutes without mashing or stirring the peaches. This will help retain their shape for serving later.

Step 3: Once the peach mixture is cooked, strain the syrup through a fine-mesh sieve to separate the liquid from the fruit. Store the poached peaches in an airtight container in the refrigerator for later use.

Step 4: In four glasses filled with ice cubes, pour an equal amount of the peach syrup and the brewed black tea. Top off each glass with sparkling water, adjusting the quantity based on taste preference.

Step 5: Serve the iced tea immediately. If preparing for later, avoid using ice cubes; instead, use frozen tea cubes or store the peach tea mixture in tightly sealed jars placed in an ice-filled cooler.

recipes.name: Mango Iced Tea
ingredients: 1 tablespoon black tea or 2 tea sachets
Lemon or lime wedges (for garnish, optional)
½ cup fresh or canned mango pulp
Chopped or cubed mangoes (for garnish, optional)
directions: Step 1: In a saucepan, combine 1 liter of water with 950 grams of organic sugar. Heat on low until the sugar dissolves, stirring regularly.
Step 2: Once the sugar has dissolved, strain the mixture using a colander to remove any undissolved sugar.
Step 3: Allow the syrup mixture to cool down completely.
Step 4: In a separate pot, bring 350 ml of water to a boil. Once boiling, add the black tea or tea sachets and let it steep for 3-5 minutes.
Step 5: Strain the brewed tea and combine it with the cooled lime-sugar syrup, mixing well.
Step 6: Refrigerate the combined mixture until chilled.
Step 7: To serve, blend 1 cup of the iced tea mixture with 1 cup of mango pulp and 1 cup of water until well combined.
Step 8: Fill glasses with ice cubes and pour the mango iced tea over the ice. Garnish with chopped mango and mint leaves, if desired.
Step 9: Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing mango iced tea.

Use natural light to emphasize the golden hues of the tea and the bright green of the mint. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase the textures of the ice and mango pulp. Use a shallow depth of field to blur the background, focusing on the refreshing drink, evoking a tropical, summery mood.

recipes.name: Lychee Iced Tea
ingredients: 1 tablespoon black tea or 2 black tea sachets
7-8 tablespoons lime juice or 3-4 tablespoons lemon juice
Lemon or lime wedges for garnish (optional)
directions: Step 1: Peel the lychee, remove the seeds, and slice the fruit into pieces.
Step 2: In a mixing bowl, combine the sliced lychee with 5-6 tablespoons of sugar and 3 tablespoons of water; blend until a smooth mixture is formed. Add more water if necessary.
Step 3: Strain the lychee mixture through a sieve and set aside.
Step 4: In a saucepan, combine 1 liter of water and 950 grams of sugar. Heat over medium until the sugar dissolves completely.
Step 5: Once the mixture reaches a bubbling point, add the black tea. Let it simmer for 1-2 minutes, then remove from heat.
Step 6: Squeeze in the lime or lemon juice and allow the mixture to cool down. Strain the iced tea to remove the tea leaves.
Step 7: Refrigerate the strained iced tea to chill thoroughly.
Step 8: Prepare serving glasses by filling them with ice cubes; pour the chilled iced tea into the glasses, leaving some space at the top.
Step 9: Add 2 tablespoons of the prepared lychee juice to each glass, stir gently, and garnish with mint leaves and lemon or lime wedges if desired.
Step 10: Serve immediately and enjoy your refreshing Lychee Iced Tea.

recipes.name: All-Natural Russian Tea
ingredients: 4 black tea bags or 1 tablespoon loose black tea
1/4 cup granulated sugar, adjust to taste
directions: Step 1: In a medium saucepan, bring 6 cups of cold water, the cinnamon stick, and whole cloves to a boil.
Step 2: Once boiling, remove the saucepan from heat and add the tea bags or loose tea. Cover and steep for 5 minutes.
Step 3: Strain the tea to remove the tea leaves and whole spices, and set aside.
Step 4: In a small saucepan, combine the orange juice, lemon juice, sugar, and grated nutmeg. Heat gently until the sugar dissolves.
Step 5: Add the juice mixture to the strained tea and mix thoroughly.
Step 6: Taste the tea and add additional sugar if desired. Reheat gently without boiling, then serve.

recipes.name: Dainty Egg and Chive Tea Sandwiches
ingredients: Salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
directions: Step 1: Place the eggs in a small saucepan and cover them with cold water.
Step 2: Bring the water to a boil and cook the eggs for 6 minutes.
Step 3: Drain the cooked eggs and run them under cold water until they are cool enough to handle.
Step 4: Peel the eggs and coarsely crumble or grate them into a mixing bowl.
Step 5: Add the salad cream, mayonnaise, and chopped chives to the eggs, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Step 6: Use a serrated knife to cut off the crusts of the brown bread slices and set aside for homemade breadcrumbs.
Step 7: Spread softened butter on one side of each slice of bread.
Step 8: Divide the egg mixture evenly between 4 slices of buttered bread, then top each with another buttered slice.
Step 9: Stack 2 sandwiches together and cut them into 3 finger-sized pieces.
Step 10: Serve immediately.

recipes.name: Tangerine Raspberry Iced Tea
ingredients: 1 to 1.5 cups Pomegranate juice, adjust to taste
Optional garnish: orange or tangerine slices
directions: 1. Pour 6 cups of water into a medium-large saucepan. Bring to a boil.
2. Once boiling, remove the saucepan from heat and add the Tangerine and Raspberry tea bags. Allow to steep for 30 minutes.
3. While the tea is steeping, fill a pitcher halfway with ice cubes.
4. After 30 minutes, remove the tea bags and transfer the brewed tea to the pitcher over the ice.
5. Stir in 1 cup of pomegranate juice. Adjust sweetness by adding more juice if desired. Stir well to mix.
6. Serve the iced tea garnished with slices of orange or tangerine and fresh raspberries.

recipes.name: Green Tea Infused Basmati Rice
directions: Step 1: Place the green tea bags in a 4-cup measuring cup and cover with 3 cups of water.
Step 2: Steep the tea bags for 7-10 minutes, then discard them.
Step 3: In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed basmati rice, minced garlic, minced ginger, and the prepared green tea.
Step 4: Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat.
Step 5: Once boiling, cover the saucepan, reduce the heat to medium-low, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Step 6: Add the frozen mixed vegetables to the saucepan and cover again.
Step 7: Cook for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the tea is absorbed and the vegetables are hot and crisp-tender.
Step 8: Stir in the chopped green onions and toasted sesame seeds, then season with salt and pepper to taste.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant bowl of green tea infused basmati rice, artfully styled with a sprinkle of toasted sesame seeds and a scattering of bright green onions atop. Utilize soft, diffused natural light to enhance the rich textures of the rice and the colorful mixed vegetables. Position the bowl on a rustic wooden surface, complemented by a delicate white linen napkin. Shoot from a 45-degree angle to emphasize height and depth, with a shallow depth of field to softly blur the background, creating an inviting and serene mood.

video_script.title: Green Tea Infused Basmati Rice Recipe
video_script.description: Learn how to make a delicious and aromatic green tea infused basmati rice with vegetables.

scenes.image_prompt: A beautifully plated bowl of green tea infused basmati rice garnished with green onions and sesame seeds, vibrant colors showcasing the mixed vegetables.
scenes.text: Welcome to our delicious green tea infused basmati rice!
scenes.voice_over: Today, we're making a fragrant and colorful green tea infused basmati rice that's both healthy and satisfying.

scenes.image_prompt: An overhead shot of the ingredients neatly arranged on a countertop, including green tea bags, basmati rice, garlic, ginger, mixed vegetables, green onions, and sesame seeds.
scenes.voice_over: Gather 4 green tea bags, 1 cup of rinsed basmati rice, minced garlic and ginger, frozen mixed vegetables, green onions, toasted sesame seeds, and some salt and pepper.

scenes.image_prompt: A 4-cup measuring cup filled with 3 cups of water and green tea bags steeping inside.
scenes.voice_over: Start by placing the green tea bags in a measuring cup and covering them with 3 cups of water. Let it steep for 7 to 10 minutes before discarding the bags.

scenes.image_prompt: A medium saucepan on the stove with a mixture of rinsed basmati rice, minced garlic, minced ginger, and green tea being poured in from the measuring cup.
scenes.voice_over: In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed basmati rice, minced garlic, minced ginger, and your prepared green tea.

scenes.image_prompt: The saucepan with rice and tea mixture boiling, visible steam rising as the lid is on the side.
scenes.voice_over: Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat.

scenes.image_prompt: The saucepan covered and simmering on the stove, a timer in the background indicating 10 minutes.
scenes.voice_over: Once boiling, cover the saucepan, reduce the heat to medium-low, and let it simmer for 10 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Adding frozen mixed vegetables to the saucepan, bright colors contrasting with the rice.
scenes.voice_over: Next, add your frozen mixed vegetables to the saucepan. Cover and cook for an additional 5 to 10 minutes, until the tea is absorbed and the veggies are crisp-tender.

scenes.image_prompt: A hand stirring the rice mixture in the saucepan, green onions and sesame seeds scattered on top.
scenes.voice_over: Finally, stir in chopped green onions and toasted sesame seeds. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

scenes.image_prompt: A serving of green tea infused basmati rice in a bowl, garnished and served with chopsticks.
scenes.voice_over: Your green tea infused basmati rice is ready to serve. Enjoy this vibrant and tasty dish!

cooking_tips: For added flavor, consider using low-sodium vegetable broth instead of water for cooking the rice.
You can customize the vegetables based on your preferences or seasonal availability.

recipes.name: Honey Milk Tea
directions: 1. Steep the 2 orange pekoe tea bags in 1 cup of boiling water for 3 to 5 minutes until the color turns dark red.
2. Discard the tea bags and allow the tea to cool.
3. In a glass or cocktail shaker, combine the 5 ice cubes, 4 teaspoons of sweetened condensed milk, and 3 teaspoons of honey.
4. Pour the cooled tea into the mixture and stir well. If the tea is still warm, add more ice to your preference.
5. Enjoy the flavorful Honey Milk Tea.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a close-up shot of a tall glass of honey milk tea, showcasing its creamy golden hue with a swirl of sweetened condensed milk. Use soft, diffused natural light to accentuate the textures of the ice cubes and the smooth surface of the tea. Style the scene with a rustic wooden table, a delicate white saucer, and a honey dipper drizzled with honey. Incorporate fresh orange slices and a sprig of mint for color contrast. Aim for a shallow depth of field, keeping the glass in sharp focus while softly blurring the background for a warm, inviting mood.

video_script.title: How to Make Delicious Honey Milk Tea
video_script.description: Join us in this tutorial as we make a refreshing Honey Milk Tea that's perfect for any time of day!

scenes.image_prompt: A beautifully styled cup of Honey Milk Tea with a honey dipper and an orange pekoe tea bag next to it, surrounded by vibrant plants.

scenes.image_prompt: An overhead view of all the ingredients laid out on a kitchen counter: tea bags, boiling water, ice cubes, sweetened condensed milk, and honey.
scenes.voice_over: For this recipe, you will need 2 orange pekoe tea bags, 1 cup of boiling water, 5 ice cubes, 4 teaspoons of sweetened condensed milk, and 3 teaspoons of honey.

scenes.image_prompt: A close-up of tea bags steeping in a glass cup filled with boiling water, steam rising from it.
scenes.voice_over: First, steep the 2 orange pekoe tea bags in 1 cup of boiling water for 3 to 5 minutes until the color turns a dark red.

scenes.voice_over: After steeping, discard the tea bags and allow the tea to cool to room temperature.

scenes.image_prompt: A beautiful clear glass or cocktail shaker with ice cubes, sweetened condensed milk, and honey being added.
scenes.voice_over: In a glass or cocktail shaker, combine the 5 ice cubes, 4 teaspoons of sweetened condensed milk, and 3 teaspoons of honey.

scenes.image_prompt: A pouring shot of the cooled dark red tea being added to the shaker filled with condensed milk and honey, creating a swirl of colors.
scenes.voice_over: Pour the cooled tea into the mixture and stir well. If the tea is still warm, feel free to add more ice to your preference.

scenes.voice_over: And there you have it! Enjoy your flavorful Honey Milk Tea, perfect for sipping any time of day.
